result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven M Rempala

defendant.name: Rempala, Steven M
defendant.address: 2310 S Green Bay Rd #C141, Racine, WI 53406

records.addlTxt:
10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven M Rempala in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Steven M Rempala. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF280 Cts 1, 2 & 3- NO CONTEST. 
22CF70 Cts 1 & 2- NO CONTEST. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CF280 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY. 22CF70 Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY with Cts 3-5 being dismissed and read in. 21CF62, 21CF1828, 22CF72 and 21CF652 will be dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
21CF280-
Ct 1-
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 initial confinement with 1 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail STAYED
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
15 hours of community service if not employed or in school. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
No contact with drug dealers or users. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

Ct 2-
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 initial confinement with 2 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Ct 3-
30 days Racine County Jail imposed and stayed. 
1 year probation. 

22CF70-
Ct 1-
2 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 1 initial confinement with 1 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Ct 2-
5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 initial confinement with 3 extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward. 
notice of hearing

Defense asks for new STC; new information relayed to Atty Ramirez that could indicate a conflict

BTC: Matters to remain as scheduled; defense will advise the Court if there is a conflict

9:11 AM Defendant Steven M Rempala appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared in court for Steven M Rempala, Attorney Diane Donohoo appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense has filed bond motions; State objects

BTC: Motion to modify bond is denied
Status conference scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on February 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.A.G (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Steven M Rempala appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Steven M Rempala. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
